intro: Matthiola euboea, commonly known as the Euboean stock, is a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Greek island of Euboea and is characterized by its fragrant, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, hairy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Matthiola euboea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for its delicate blossoms.
